citeinfo.title: EPA Renewable Energy Sites

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Solid Waste and Emergency Response (OSWER)

idinfo.useconst: Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata.

cntperp.cntorg: Center for Program Analysis, Office of Solid Waste and Emergency Response, U.S. Environment

dataqual.logic: Points were verified to be located in or within 5 miles of reported state.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: This data concerns the location of facilities and sites that are regulated by, or of interest to, the EPA in conducting its regulatory mission. The information on the facilities and sites, including the locations, has been gathered from a number of sources. While EPA subjects the data to Quality Assurance (QA) procedures, the Agency cannot vouch for the reliability of all the data. Users of the data (or any portion thereof) may wish to verify its accuracy before use. Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at http://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html)

srcinfo.srccontr: Includes all abandoned hardrock mines and mineral processing sites listed in the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Information System (CERCLIS) as well as many AMLs with emergency response actions that are not listed in CERCLIS. AML data includes information from the AML inventory dated 2/27/2008 and includes CERCLIS information current as of January 2008. Acreage from the AML Inventory was used in most cases. In cases where acreage was not provided in the AML Inventory, CERCLIS acreage was used.

Includes data in the Assessment Cleanup and Redevelopment Exchange (ACRES) database, queried on 7/8/08. Data includes information on properties associated with Brownfields Grants awarded in fiscal year 2003 and beyond, where an assessment or cleanup activity has been completed and EPA Brownfields funding was expended. This includes: Assessment, Cleanup, Revolving Loan Fund, Section 128 and Targeted Brownfields Assessment grants.

Includes all sites from the RCRA 2020 Universe Inventory from July 2007. Acreage information was only provided for the 2008 Baseline Inventory sites, but site latitude and longitude information was provided for all sites.

Includes Superfund sites included in the EPA OSWER Cross-Program Revitalization Measure (CPRM) universe, with information provided by the Superfund Office on 7/24/08. Superfund site-specific information in available in the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Information System (CERCLIS).
Wind power class for states without high resolution data (low resolution data) http://www.nrel.gov/gis/data_analysis.html
Annual average daily total solar resource LA Tilt http://www.nrel.gov/gis/data_analysis.html
Annual average daily total solar resource, direct normal irradiance (DNI) http://www.nrel.gov/gis/data_analysis.html

An estimate of the biomass resources available by county for the following feedstock categories: crop residues, methane emissions from manure management, methane emissions from landfills and wastewater treatment facilities, forest residues, primary and secondary mill residues, urban wood waste, and dedicated energy crops. http://www.nrel.gov/gis/data_analysis.html

citeinfo.title: NREL Transmission Lines for Conterminous United States

srcinfo.srccontr: Provides kilovolt value and distances to the nearest transmission line. Data from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) circa 1993. http://www.nrel.gov/gis/data_analysis.html

citeinfo.title: ESRI U.S. National Transportation Atlas Railroads

srcinfo.srccontr: Used to calculate the approximate distance to the nearest railway.

procstep.procdesc: Compiled data from EPA databases (CERCLIS, ACRES, and RCRA 2020 Universe Inventory) and plotted points and exported as EPA Tracked Sites Shapefile
Joined EPA Tracked Sites to NREL Biomass, Solar (DNI and LATILT), and Wind Data to obtain resource information for the sites.
Joined EPA Tracked Sites to NREL FEMA transmission line data and ESRI Highway and Railway data sets to obtain distance in miles from this infrastructure.

enttyp.enttypd: Renewable Energy Potential for EPA Tracked Sites

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

Indicates whether the site is a federal facility

edom.edomvd: Site is not a Federal Facility

attr.attrdef: Acreage used for mapping
Indicates which renewable energy types have potential at the site
Indicates sites with utility wind energy generation potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with community wind energy generation potential

edom.edomvd: ndicates sites with utility stirling engine and/or trough and power tower system Concentrated Solar Power (CSP) energy generation potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with utility Photovoltaic (PV) solar energy generation potential

attr.attrdef: Indicates sites with biopower facility siting potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with biopower facility siting potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with biorefinery facility siting potential

attr.attrdef: Indicates sites with non-grid connected wind energy generation potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with non-grid connected wind energy generation potential

edom.edomvd: Indicates sites with non-grid Photovoltaic (PV) generation potential

attr.attrdef: Latitude in decimal degrees, NAD 27 projection
Longitude in decimal degrees, NAD 27 projection
Distance in miles to the nearest transmission line
Kilovolt capacity of the nearest transmission line
Distance in miles to the nearest graded road
Distance in miles to the nearest railway
Measurement of the wind power class, measured at 50 meters above ground
Measurement of the wind speed, measured in Watts per meter squared (W/m2 ) at 50 meters
Description of the wind energy potential
Measurement of the direct normal irradiance (DNI) solar resource availability in kilowatt hour per meter squared per day (kWh/m2/day) for utility scale projects
Description of the solar energy potential for utility scale project
Measurement of the solar resource availability in kilowatt hour per meter squared per day (kWh/m2/day) for non-grid connected projects
Description of the solar energy potential for non-grid projects

Cumulative biomass resources in metric tons/year, used to determine biopower facility siting potential (includes: crops, forests, primary and secondary mills; urban wood waste; and methane emissions from manure management, landfills, and domestic wastewater treatment)
Description of the biomass energy potential for siting biopower facilities
Cumulative crop residues in metric tons/year, used to determine biorefinery siting potential (includes: crops; forests; primary and secondary mills and urban wood waste)
Description of the biomass energy potential for siting biorefinery facilities

Crop residues (dry metric tons/year), includes residues from corn, wheat, soybeans, cotton, sorghum, barley, oats, rice, rye, canola, dry edible beans, dry edible peas, peanuts, potatoes, safflower, sunflower, sugarcane, and flaxseed
Methane emissions from manure management (metric tons/year), includes dairy cows, beef cows, hogs and pigs, sheep, chickens and layers, broilers, and turkey
Forest residues (dry metric tons/year), includes logging residues and other removable material left after carrying out silviculture operations and site conversions

Primary mill residues (dry metric tons/year), includes wood materials (coarse and fine) and bark generated at manufacturing plants (primary wood-using mills) when round wood products are processed into primary wood products
Secondary mill residues (dry metric tons/year), includes wood scraps and sawdust from woodworking shops
Urban wood residues (dry metric tons/year), includes wood residues from wood chips, pallets, utility tree trimming and/or private tree companies, and construction and demolition sites
Methane emissions from landfills (metric tons/year)
Methane emissions from domestic wastewater treatment (metric tons/year)
Energy crops (dry metric tons/year), includes hybrid poplar, willow, and switchgrass on Conservation Reserve Program lands

Cumulative biomass resources (terajoule/year) (includes: crops, forests, primary and secondary mills; urban wood waste; and methane emissions from manure management, landfills, and domestic wastewater treatment)
Cumulative crop residues (terajoule/year) (includes: crops; forests; primary and secondary mills and urban wood waste)
Crop residues (terajoule/year) a conversion factor of 6,500 BTU/pound was used
Methane emissions from manure management (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 24,000 BTU/pound was used
Forest residues (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 8,500 BTU/pound was used
Primary mill residues (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 4,700 BTU/pound was used
Secondary mill residues (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 4,700 BTU/pound was used
Urban wood residues (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 4,700 BTU/pound was used
Methane emissions from landfills (terajoule/year), a conversion factor of 24,000 BTU/pound was used
Methane emissions from domestic wastewater treatment (terajoule/year) , a conversion factor of 24,000 BTU/pound was used
Energy crops (terajoule/yr ), includes hybrid poplar, willow, and switchgrass on Conservation Reserve Program lands a conversion factor of 6,500 BTU/pound was used

overview.eaover: These attributes describe the EPA Tracked Sites and the renewable energy elements they posses.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Environmental Protection Agency, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
